title: EUPHEME
content:
EUPHEME was the personified spirit (daimona) of praise, acclamation, and shouts of triumph. She and
        her three sisters--Eukleia (Good Repute), Euthenia
        (Prosperity) and Philophrosyne (Welcome)--were probably the goddesses known
        collectively as the younger Kharites (Charites). Her opposite number was
        Momos (Critique).

HEPHAISTOS & AGLAIA
        (Orphic Rhapsodies Frag)

Other references not currently quoted here: Orphic Fragments.

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
